sub_topic: Coin flipping and probability of getting heads or tails
message_1: A coin has been flipped 20 times and landed on heads 14 times. What is the probability of getting tails on the next flip?
message_2: The probability of getting tails on the next flip is independent of the previous flips. A fair coin has two sides, heads and tails, so the probability of getting tails on the next flip is 1/2 or 50%.
